label.en: 24/25 S regular part 6 2.5 CP HV Eng
label.et: 24/25 K PÕ 6. osa 2.5 EAP HV Eng

description.en: Planning, writing and discussing philosophical papers.

objectives.en: To develop student's skills in academic writing, discussion and research.
objectives.et: Arendada erialase akadeemilise diskussiooni, kirjutamise ja uurimistöö oskusi.

learning_outcomes.en: On successful completion of the course, the student has improved her/his research skills, s/he is able to present the results orally and as article manuscript.
learning_outcomes.et: Kursuse sooritanud üliõpilane: omab uurimistöövilumusi, oskust oma töö tulemusi esitada suuliselt ja kirjalikult artikli vormis.

independent_work.et: Taking part in colloquia and asking questions, presenting at least once a semester, chairing a colloquium at least once a semester.

description.et:
PhD students have to participate in all the colloquia.
For the missed colloquia, please send in your written comments and questions about the presentation.

Giving one presentation per semester.
Chairing one colloquium per semester.

grade_preconditions.et:
PhD students have to attend all colloquia, unless having a reasonable excuse.
If a PhD student is abroad for the whole semester, they need to do a presentation about their research in progress abroad.
For the missed colloquia, please send in your written comments and questions about the presentation.

grade_evaluation.et:
In order to pass the PhD Seminar, a PhD student has to:
1. give a presentation,
2. attend the colloquia and ask questions,
3. chair a colloquium.

debt_elimination.et: For the missed colloquia, please send in your written comments and questions about the presentation.

description.et: Wednesdays 16-18 at Zoom, see timetable at: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1gYuvZkg8J3l2Z7tfEwa8uVBz9WdbitIk_gHul4Lpp5Y/edit

Departmental Colloquium: In order to pass Doctoral Seminar, a PhD student student must attend the departmental colloquium at least 3 times during the semester (which take place Mondays 12-14, every other week).
